page.title: 07Tourism & hotels, Freshfield
page.content: Visitors to the area are mainly day trippers from Liverpool travelling by train to Freshfield. Then they walk to the beach past the{National Trust}or the{Nature Conservancy}reserves. In the summer and on Sundays the squirrel reserve has thousands of visitors. Vandals sometimes climb over fences, pull up trees, signs and fences and make fires with them. A few people ride motorbikes over the dunes. In general, however, the wardens are pleased to have visitors. Meals are served at the Grapes Hotel in the evening and at dinnertime. Many golfers eat there in the summer as it is the nearest restaurant to the golf courses. The Treetops Hotel is busiest on weekday evenings because most of the guests are business people.
